finish_reason.description: The reason why the sample generation was finished.

model.description: The model used for generating the sample.

usage.description: Token usage details for the sample.

total_tokens.description: The total number of tokens used.

completion_tokens.description: The number of completion tokens generated.

prompt_tokens.description: The number of prompt tokens used.

cached_tokens.description: The number of tokens retrieved from cache.

temperature.description: The sampling temperature used.

max_completion_tokens.description: The maximum number of tokens allowed for completion.

top_p.description: The top_p value used for sampling.

seed.description: The seed used for generating the sample.

schemas.name: EvalRunOutputItemList
schemas.description: An object representing a list of output items for an evaluation run.

object.description: The type of this object. It is always set to "list".

data.description: An array of eval run output item objects.

first_id.description: The identifier of the first eval run output item in the data array.

last_id.description: The identifier of the last eval run output item in the data array.

has_more.description: Indicates whether there are more eval run output items available.

schemas.name: EvalStoredCompletionsDataSourceConfig
schemas.description: Deprecated in favor of LogsDataSourceConfig.

type.description: The type of data source. Always `stored_completions`.

schema.description:
The json schema for the run data source items.
Learn how to build JSON schemas [here](https://json-schema.org/).

schemas.name: EvalStoredCompletionsSource
schemas.description: A StoredCompletionsRunDataSource configuration describing a set of filters

type.description: The type of source. Always `stored_completions`.

model.description: An optional model to filter by (e.g., 'gpt-4o').

created_after.description: An optional Unix timestamp to filter items created after this time.

created_before.description: An optional Unix timestamp to filter items created before this time.

limit.description: An optional maximum number of items to return.

schemas.name: FileExpirationAfter
schemas.description: The expiration policy for a file. By default, files with `purpose=batch` expire after 30 days and all other files are persisted until they are manually deleted.

anchor.description: Anchor timestamp after which the expiration policy applies. Supported anchors: `created_at`.

seconds.description: The number of seconds after the anchor time that the file will expire. Must be between 3600 (1 hour) and 2592000 (30 days).

schemas.name: FilePath
schemas.description: A path to a file.

type.description: The type of the file path. Always `file_path`.

file_id.description: The ID of the file.

index.description: The index of the file in the list of files.

schemas.name: FileSearchRanker
schemas.description: The ranker to use for the file search. If not specified will use the `auto` ranker.

schemas.name: FileSearchRankingOptions
schemas.description:
The ranking options for the file search. If not specified, the file search tool will use the `auto` ranker and a score_threshold of 0.

See the [file search tool documentation](https://platform.openai.com/docs/assistants/tools/file-search#customizing-file-search-settings) for more information.

score_threshold.description: The score threshold for the file search. All values must be a floating point number between 0 and 1.

schemas.name: FileSearchToolCall
schemas.description:
The results of a file search tool call. See the 
[file search guide](https://platform.openai.com/docs/guides/tools-file-search) for more information.

id.description: The unique ID of the file search tool call.

type.description: The type of the file search tool call. Always `file_search_call`.

status.description:
The status of the file search tool call. One of `in_progress`, 
`searching`, `incomplete` or `failed`,

queries.description: The queries used to search for files.

results.description: The results of the file search tool call.

file_id.description: The unique ID of the file.

text.description: The text that was retrieved from the file.

score.description: The relevance score of the file - a value between 0 and 1.

schemas.name: FineTuneChatRequestInput
schemas.description:
The per-line training example of a fine-tuning input file for chat models using the supervised method.
Input messages may contain text or image content only. Audio and file input messages
are not currently supported for fine-tuning.

tools.description: A list of tools the model may generate JSON inputs for.

functions.description: A list of functions the model may generate JSON inputs for.

schemas.name: FineTuneDPOHyperparameters
schemas.description: The hyperparameters used for the DPO fine-tuning job.

beta.description: The beta value for the DPO method. A higher beta value will increase the weight of the penalty between the policy and reference model.

batch_size.description: Number of examples in each batch. A larger batch size means that model parameters are updated less frequently, but with lower variance.

learning_rate_multiplier.description: Scaling factor for the learning rate. A smaller learning rate may be useful to avoid overfitting.

n_epochs.description: The number of epochs to train the model for. An epoch refers to one full cycle through the training dataset.

schemas.name: FineTuneDPOMethod
schemas.description: Configuration for the DPO fine-tuning method.

schemas.name: FineTuneMethod
schemas.description: The method used for fine-tuning.

type.description: The type of method. Is either `supervised`, `dpo`, or `reinforcement`.

schemas.name: FineTunePreferenceRequestInput
schemas.description:
The per-line training example of a fine-tuning input file for chat models using the dpo method.
Input messages may contain text or image content only. Audio and file input messages
are not currently supported for fine-tuning.

tools.description: A list of tools the model may generate JSON inputs for.

preferred_output.description: The preferred completion message for the output.

non_preferred_output.description: The non-preferred completion message for the output.

schemas.name: FineTuneReinforcementHyperparameters
schemas.description: The hyperparameters used for the reinforcement fine-tuning job.

batch_size.description: Number of examples in each batch. A larger batch size means that model parameters are updated less frequently, but with lower variance.

learning_rate_multiplier.description: Scaling factor for the learning rate. A smaller learning rate may be useful to avoid overfitting.

n_epochs.description: The number of epochs to train the model for. An epoch refers to one full cycle through the training dataset.

compute_multiplier.description: Multiplier on amount of compute used for exploring search space during training.

eval_interval.description: The number of training steps between evaluation runs.

eval_samples.description: Number of evaluation samples to generate per training step.

schemas.name: FineTuneReinforcementMethod
schemas.description: Configuration for the reinforcement fine-tuning method.

grader.description: The grader used for the fine-tuning job.

schemas.name: FineTuneReinforcementRequestInput
schemas.description:
Per-line training example for reinforcement fine-tuning. Note that `messages` and `tools` are the only reserved keywords.
Any other arbitrary key-value data can be included on training datapoints and will be available to reference during grading under the `{{ item.XXX }}` template variable.
Input messages may contain text or image content only. Audio and file input messages
are not currently supported for fine-tuning.

tools.description: A list of tools the model may generate JSON inputs for.

schemas.name: FineTuneSupervisedHyperparameters
schemas.description: The hyperparameters used for the fine-tuning job.

batch_size.description: Number of examples in each batch. A larger batch size means that model parameters are updated less frequently, but with lower variance.

learning_rate_multiplier.description: Scaling factor for the learning rate. A smaller learning rate may be useful to avoid overfitting.

n_epochs.description: The number of epochs to train the model for. An epoch refers to one full cycle through the training dataset.

schemas.name: FineTuneSupervisedMethod
schemas.description: Configuration for the supervised fine-tuning method.

schemas.name: FineTuningCheckpointPermission
schemas.description: The `checkpoint.permission` object represents a permission for a fine-tuned model checkpoint.

id.description: The permission identifier, which can be referenced in the API endpoints.

created_at.description: The Unix timestamp (in seconds) for when the permission was created.

project_id.description: The project identifier that the permission is for.

object.description: The object type, which is always "checkpoint.permission".

type.description: The type of the integration being enabled for the fine-tuning job

wandb.description:
The settings for your integration with Weights and Biases. This payload specifies the project that
metrics will be sent to. Optionally, you can set an explicit display name for your run, add tags
to your run, and set a default entity (team, username, etc) to be associated with your run.

project.description: The name of the project that the new run will be created under.

name.description: A display name to set for the run. If not set, we will use the Job ID as the name.

entity.description:
The entity to use for the run. This allows you to set the team or username of the WandB user that you would
like associated with the run. If not set, the default entity for the registered WandB API key is used.

tags.description:
A list of tags to be attached to the newly created run. These tags are passed through directly to WandB. Some
default tags are generated by OpenAI: "openai/finetune", "openai/{base-model}", "openai/{ftjob-abcdef}".

schemas.name: FineTuningJob
schemas.description: The `fine_tuning.job` object represents a fine-tuning job that has been created through the API.

id.description: The object identifier, which can be referenced in the API endpoints.

created_at.description: The Unix timestamp (in seconds) for when the fine-tuning job was created.

error.description: For fine-tuning jobs that have `failed`, this will contain more information on the cause of the failure.

param.description: The parameter that was invalid, usually `training_file` or `validation_file`. This field will be null if the failure was not parameter-specific.

fine_tuned_model.description: The name of the fine-tuned model that is being created. The value will be null if the fine-tuning job is still running.

finished_at.description: The Unix timestamp (in seconds) for when the fine-tuning job was finished. The value will be null if the fine-tuning job is still running.

hyperparameters.description: The hyperparameters used for the fine-tuning job. This value will only be returned when running `supervised` jobs.

batch_size.description:
Number of examples in each batch. A larger batch size means that model parameters
are updated less frequently, but with lower variance.

learning_rate_multiplier.description:
Scaling factor for the learning rate. A smaller learning rate may be useful to avoid
overfitting.

n_epochs.description:
The number of epochs to train the model for. An epoch refers to one full cycle
through the training dataset.

model.description: The base model that is being fine-tuned.

object.description: The object type, which is always "fine_tuning.job".

organization_id.description: The organization that owns the fine-tuning job.

result_files.description: The compiled results file ID(s) for the fine-tuning job. You can retrieve the results with the [Files API](https://platform.openai.com/docs/api-reference/files/retrieve-contents).

status.description: The current status of the fine-tuning job, which can be either `validating_files`, `queued`, `running`, `succeeded`, `failed`, or `cancelled`.

trained_tokens.description: The total number of billable tokens processed by this fine-tuning job. The value will be null if the fine-tuning job is still running.

training_file.description: The file ID used for training. You can retrieve the training data with the [Files API](https://platform.openai.com/docs/api-reference/files/retrieve-contents).

validation_file.description: The file ID used for validation. You can retrieve the validation results with the [Files API](https://platform.openai.com/docs/api-reference/files/retrieve-contents).

integrations.description: A list of integrations to enable for this fine-tuning job.

seed.description: The seed used for the fine-tuning job.

estimated_finish.description: The Unix timestamp (in seconds) for when the fine-tuning job is estimated to finish. The value will be null if the fine-tuning job is not running.

schemas.name: FineTuningJobCheckpoint
schemas.description: The `fine_tuning.job.checkpoint` object represents a model checkpoint for a fine-tuning job that is ready to use.

id.description: The checkpoint identifier, which can be referenced in the API endpoints.

created_at.description: The Unix timestamp (in seconds) for when the checkpoint was created.

fine_tuned_model_checkpoint.description: The name of the fine-tuned checkpoint model that is created.

step_number.description: The step number that the checkpoint was created at.

metrics.description: Metrics at the step number during the fine-tuning job.

fine_tuning_job_id.description: The name of the fine-tuning job that this checkpoint was created from.

object.description: The object type, which is always "fine_tuning.job.checkpoint".

schemas.name: FineTuningJobEvent
schemas.description: Fine-tuning job event object

object.description: The object type, which is always "fine_tuning.job.event".

id.description: The object identifier.

created_at.description: The Unix timestamp (in seconds) for when the fine-tuning job was created.

level.description: The log level of the event.

type.description: The type of event.

data.description: The data associated with the event.

description.description: A description of what the function does, used by the model to choose when and how to call the function.

name.description: The name of the function to be called. Must be a-z, A-Z, 0-9, or contain underscores and dashes, with a maximum length of 64.

strict.description: Whether to enable strict schema adherence when generating the function call. If set to true, the model will follow the exact schema defined in the `parameters` field. Only a subset of JSON Schema is supported when `strict` is `true`. Learn more about Structured Outputs in the [function calling guide](https://platform.openai.com/docs/guides/function-calling).

schemas.name: FunctionParameters
schemas.description:
The parameters the functions accepts, described as a JSON Schema object. See the [guide](https://platform.openai.com/docs/guides/function-calling) for examples, and the [JSON Schema reference](https://json-schema.org/understanding-json-schema/) for documentation about the format. 

Omitting `parameters` defines a function with an empty parameter list.

schemas.name: FunctionToolCall
schemas.description:
A tool call to run a function. See the 
[function calling guide](https://platform.openai.com/docs/guides/function-calling) for more information.

id.description: The unique ID of the function tool call.

type.description: The type of the function tool call. Always `function_call`.

call_id.description: The unique ID of the function tool call generated by the model.

name.description: The name of the function to run.

arguments.description: A JSON string of the arguments to pass to the function.

status.description:
The status of the item. One of `in_progress`, `completed`, or
`incomplete`. Populated when items are returned via API.

schemas.name: FunctionToolCallOutput
schemas.description: The output of a function tool call.

id.description:
The unique ID of the function tool call output. Populated when this item
is returned via API.

type.description: The type of the function tool call output. Always `function_call_output`.

call_id.description: The unique ID of the function tool call generated by the model.

output.description: A JSON string of the output of the function tool call.

status.description:
The status of the item. One of `in_progress`, `completed`, or
`incomplete`. Populated when items are returned via API.

schemas.name: GraderLabelModel
schemas.description:
A LabelModelGrader object which uses a model to assign labels to each item
in the evaluation.

type.description: The object type, which is always `label_model`.

name.description: The name of the grader.

model.description: The model to use for the evaluation. Must support structured outputs.

labels.description: The labels to assign to each item in the evaluation.

passing_labels.description: The labels that indicate a passing result. Must be a subset of labels.

schemas.name: GraderMulti
schemas.description: A MultiGrader object combines the output of multiple graders to produce a single score.

type.description: The object type, which is always `multi`.

name.description: The name of the grader.

calculate_output.description: A formula to calculate the output based on grader results.

schemas.name: GraderPython
schemas.description: A PythonGrader object that runs a python script on the input.

type.description: The object type, which is always `python`.

name.description: The name of the grader.

source.description: The source code of the python script.

image_tag.description: The image tag to use for the python script.

schemas.name: GraderScoreModel
schemas.description: A ScoreModelGrader object that uses a model to assign a score to the input.

type.description: The object type, which is always `score_model`.

name.description: The name of the grader.

model.description: The model to use for the evaluation.

sampling_params.description: The sampling parameters for the model.

input.description: The input text. This may include template strings.

range.description: The range of the score. Defaults to `[0, 1]`.

schemas.name: GraderStringCheck
schemas.description: A StringCheckGrader object that performs a string comparison between input and reference using a specified operation.

type.description: The object type, which is always `string_check`.

name.description: The name of the grader.

input.description: The input text. This may include template strings.

reference.description: The reference text. This may include template strings.

operation.description: The string check operation to perform. One of `eq`, `ne`, `like`, or `ilike`.

schemas.name: GraderTextSimilarity
schemas.description: A TextSimilarityGrader object which grades text based on similarity metrics.

type.description: The type of grader.

name.description: The name of the grader.

evaluation_metric.description:
The evaluation metric to use. One of `cosine`, `fuzzy_match`, `bleu`, 
`gleu`, `meteor`, `rouge_1`, `rouge_2`, `rouge_3`, `rouge_4`, `rouge_5`, 
or `rouge_l`.

schemas.name: Image
schemas.description: Represents the content or the URL of an image generated by the OpenAI API.

b64_json.description: The base64-encoded JSON of the generated image. Default value for `gpt-image-1`, and only present if `response_format` is set to `b64_json` for `dall-e-2` and `dall-e-3`.

url.description: When using `dall-e-2` or `dall-e-3`, the URL of the generated image if `response_format` is set to `url` (default value). Unsupported for `gpt-image-1`.

revised_prompt.description: For `dall-e-3` only, the revised prompt that was used to generate the image.

schemas.name: ImageEditCompletedEvent
schemas.description: Emitted when image editing has completed and the final image is available.

type.description: The type of the event. Always `image_edit.completed`.

b64_json.description: Base64-encoded final edited image data, suitable for rendering as an image.

created_at.description: The Unix timestamp when the event was created.

size.description: The size of the edited image.

quality.description: The quality setting for the edited image.

background.description: The background setting for the edited image.

output_format.description: The output format for the edited image.

schemas.name: ImageEditPartialImageEvent
schemas.description: Emitted when a partial image is available during image editing streaming.

type.description: The type of the event. Always `image_edit.partial_image`.

b64_json.description: Base64-encoded partial image data, suitable for rendering as an image.

created_at.description: The Unix timestamp when the event was created.

size.description: The size of the requested edited image.

quality.description: The quality setting for the requested edited image.

background.description: The background setting for the requested edited image.

output_format.description: The output format for the requested edited image.

schemas.name: ImageGenCompletedEvent
schemas.description: Emitted when image generation has completed and the final image is available.

type.description: The type of the event. Always `image_generation.completed`.

b64_json.description: Base64-encoded image data, suitable for rendering as an image.

created_at.description: The Unix timestamp when the event was created.

size.description: The size of the generated image.

quality.description: The quality setting for the generated image.

background.description: The background setting for the generated image.

output_format.description: The output format for the generated image.

schemas.name: ImageGenPartialImageEvent
schemas.description: Emitted when a partial image is available during image generation streaming.

type.description: The type of the event. Always `image_generation.partial_image`.

b64_json.description: Base64-encoded partial image data, suitable for rendering as an image.

created_at.description: The Unix timestamp when the event was created.

size.description: The size of the requested image.

quality.description: The quality setting for the requested image.

background.description: The background setting for the requested image.

output_format.description: The output format for the requested image.

schemas.name: ImageGenTool
schemas.description: A tool that generates images using a model like `gpt-image-1`.

type.description: The type of the image generation tool. Always `image_generation`.

model.description: The image generation model to use. Default: `gpt-image-1`.

quality.description:
The quality of the generated image. One of `low`, `medium`, `high`, 
or `auto`. Default: `auto`.

size.description:
The size of the generated image. One of `1024x1024`, `1024x1536`, 
`1536x1024`, or `auto`. Default: `auto`.

output_format.description:
The output format of the generated image. One of `png`, `webp`, or 
`jpeg`. Default: `png`.

output_compression.description: Compression level for the output image. Default: 100.

moderation.description: Moderation level for the generated image. Default: `auto`.

background.description:
Background type for the generated image. One of `transparent`, 
`opaque`, or `auto`. Default: `auto`.

input_image_mask.description:
Optional mask for inpainting. Contains `image_url` 
(string, optional) and `file_id` (string, optional).

file_id.description: File ID for the mask image.

partial_images.description: Number of partial images to generate in streaming mode, from 0 (default value) to 3.

schemas.name: ImageGenToolCall
schemas.description: An image generation request made by the model.

type.description: The type of the image generation call. Always `image_generation_call`.

id.description: The unique ID of the image generation call.

status.description: The status of the image generation call.

result.description: The generated image encoded in base64.

schemas.name: ImageInputFidelity
schemas.description:
Control how much effort the model will exert to match the style and features,
especially facial features, of input images. This parameter is only supported
for `gpt-image-1`. Supports `high` and `low`. Defaults to `low`.

schemas.name: ImagesResponse
schemas.description: The response from the image generation endpoint.

created.description: The Unix timestamp (in seconds) of when the image was created.

background.description: The background parameter used for the image generation. Either `transparent` or `opaque`.

output_format.description: The output format of the image generation. Either `png`, `webp`, or `jpeg`.

size.description: The size of the image generated. Either `1024x1024`, `1024x1536`, or `1536x1024`.

quality.description: The quality of the image generated. Either `low`, `medium`, or `high`.

schemas.name: ImagesUsage
schemas.description: For `gpt-image-1` only, the token usage information for the image generation.

total_tokens.description: The total number of tokens (images and text) used for the image generation.

input_tokens.description: The number of tokens (images and text) in the input prompt.

output_tokens.description: The number of image tokens in the output image.

input_tokens_details.description: The input tokens detailed information for the image generation.

text_tokens.description: The number of text tokens in the input prompt.

image_tokens.description: The number of image tokens in the input prompt.

schemas.name: Includable
schemas.description:
Specify additional output data to include in the model response. Currently
supported values are:
- `code_interpreter_call.outputs`: Includes the outputs of python code execution
  in code interpreter tool call items.
- `computer_call_output.output.image_url`: Include image urls from the computer call output.
- `file_search_call.results`: Include the search results of
  the file search tool call.
- `message.input_image.image_url`: Include image urls from the input message.
- `message.output_text.logprobs`: Include logprobs with assistant messages.
- `reasoning.encrypted_content`: Includes an encrypted version of reasoning
  tokens in reasoning item outputs. This enables reasoning items to be used in
  multi-turn conversations when using the Responses API statelessly (like
  when the `store` parameter is set to `false`, or when an organization is
  enrolled in the zero data retention program).

schemas.name: InputAudio
schemas.description: An audio input to the model.

type.description: The type of the input item. Always `input_audio`.

format.description:
The format of the audio data. Currently supported formats are `mp3` and
`wav`.

schemas.name: InputMessage
schemas.description:
A message input to the model with a role indicating instruction following
hierarchy. Instructions given with the `developer` or `system` role take
precedence over instructions given with the `user` role.

type.description: The type of the message input. Always set to `message`.

role.description: The role of the message input. One of `user`, `system`, or `developer`.

status.description:
The status of item. One of `in_progress`, `completed`, or
`incomplete`. Populated when items are returned via API.

schemas.name: InputMessageContentList
schemas.description:
A list of one or many input items to the model, containing different content 
types.

schemas.name: Invite
schemas.description: Represents an individual `invite` to the organization.

object.description: The object type, which is always `organization.invite`

id.description: The identifier, which can be referenced in API endpoints

email.description: The email address of the individual to whom the invite was sent

role.description: `owner` or `reader`

status.description: `accepted`,`expired`, or `pending`

invited_at.description: The Unix timestamp (in seconds) of when the invite was sent.

expires_at.description: The Unix timestamp (in seconds) of when the invite expires.

accepted_at.description: The Unix timestamp (in seconds) of when the invite was accepted.

projects.description: The projects that were granted membership upon acceptance of the invite.

id.description: Project's public ID

role.description: Project membership role

object.description: The object type, which is always `organization.invite.deleted`
The object type, which is always `list`

has_more.description: The `has_more` property is used for pagination to indicate there are additional results.

email.description: Send an email to this address

role.description: `owner` or `reader`

projects.description: An array of projects to which membership is granted at the same time the org invite is accepted. If omitted, the user will be invited to the default project for compatibility with legacy behavior.

id.description: Project's public ID

role.description: Project membership role

schemas.name: Item
schemas.description: Content item used to generate a response.

schemas.name: ItemResource
schemas.description: Content item used to generate a response.

schemas.name: KeyPress
schemas.description: A collection of keypresses the model would like to perform.

type.description:
Specifies the event type. For a keypress action, this property is 
always set to `keypress`.

items.description: One of the keys the model is requesting to be pressed.

keys.description:
The combination of keys the model is requesting to be pressed. This is an
array of strings, each representing a key.

schemas.name: LocalShellExecAction
schemas.description: Execute a shell command on the server.

type.description: The type of the local shell action. Always `exec`.

timeout_ms.description: Optional timeout in milliseconds for the command.

working_directory.description: Optional working directory to run the command in.

env.description: Environment variables to set for the command.

user.description: Optional user to run the command as.

schemas.name: LocalShellTool
schemas.description: A tool that allows the model to execute shell commands in a local environment.

type.description: The type of the local shell tool. Always `local_shell`.

schemas.name: LocalShellToolCall
schemas.description: A tool call to run a command on the local shell.

type.description: The type of the local shell call. Always `local_shell_call`.

id.description: The unique ID of the local shell call.

call_id.description: The unique ID of the local shell tool call generated by the model.

status.description: The status of the local shell call.

schemas.name: LocalShellToolCallOutput
schemas.description: The output of a local shell tool call.

type.description: The type of the local shell tool call output. Always `local_shell_call_output`.

id.description: The unique ID of the local shell tool call generated by the model.

output.description: A JSON string of the output of the local shell tool call.

status.description: The status of the item. One of `in_progress`, `completed`, or `incomplete`.

schemas.name: LogProbProperties
schemas.description: A log probability object.

token.description: The token that was used to generate the log probability.

logprob.description: The log probability of the token.

bytes.description: The bytes that were used to generate the log probability.

schemas.name: MCPApprovalRequest
schemas.description: A request for human approval of a tool invocation.

type.description: The type of the item. Always `mcp_approval_request`.

id.description: The unique ID of the approval request.

server_label.description: The label of the MCP server making the request.

name.description: The name of the tool to run.

arguments.description: A JSON string of arguments for the tool.

schemas.name: MCPApprovalResponse
schemas.description: A response to an MCP approval request.

type.description: The type of the item. Always `mcp_approval_response`.

id.description: The unique ID of the approval response

approval_request_id.description: The ID of the approval request being answered.

schemas.name: MCPApprovalResponseResource
schemas.description: A response to an MCP approval request.

type.description: The type of the item. Always `mcp_approval_response`.

id.description: The unique ID of the approval response

approval_request_id.description: The ID of the approval request being answered.

schemas.name: MCPListTools
schemas.description: A list of tools available on an MCP server.

type.description: The type of the item. Always `mcp_list_tools`.

id.description: The unique ID of the list.

server_label.description: The label of the MCP server.

tools.description: The tools available on the server.

error.description: Error message if the server could not list tools.

schemas.name: MCPListToolsTool
schemas.description: A tool available on an MCP server.

name.description: The name of the tool.

input_schema.description: The JSON schema describing the tool's input.

schemas.name: MCPTool
schemas.description:
Give the model access to additional tools via remote Model Context Protocol 
(MCP) servers. [Learn more about MCP](https://platform.openai.com/docs/guides/tools-remote-mcp).

type.description: The type of the MCP tool. Always `mcp`.

server_label.description: A label for this MCP server, used to identify it in tool calls.

server_url.description:
The URL for the MCP server. One of `server_url` or `connector_id` must be 
provided.

connector_id.description:
Identifier for service connectors, like those available in ChatGPT. One of
`server_url` or `connector_id` must be provided. Learn more about service
connectors [here](https://platform.openai.com/docs/guides/tools-remote-mcp#connectors).

Currently supported `connector_id` values are:

- Dropbox: `connector_dropbox`
- Gmail: `connector_gmail`
- Google Calendar: `connector_googlecalendar`
- Google Drive: `connector_googledrive`
- Microsoft Teams: `connector_microsoftteams`
- Outlook Calendar: `connector_outlookcalendar`
- Outlook Email: `connector_outlookemail`
- SharePoint: `connector_sharepoint`

authorization.description:
An OAuth access token that can be used with a remote MCP server, either 
with a custom MCP server URL or a service connector. Your application
must handle the OAuth authorization flow and provide the token here.

server_description.description: Optional description of the MCP server, used to provide more context.

headers.description:
Optional HTTP headers to send to the MCP server. Use for authentication
or other purposes.

allowed_tools.description: List of allowed tool names or a filter object.

anyOf.title: MCP allowed tools
anyOf.description: A string array of allowed tool names

require_approval.description: Specify which of the MCP server's tools require approval.

anyOf.title: MCP tool approval filter
anyOf.description:
Specify which of the MCP server's tools require approval. Can be
`always`, `never`, or a filter object associated with tools
that require approval.

anyOf.title: MCP tool approval setting
anyOf.description:
Specify a single approval policy for all tools. One of `always` or 
`never`. When set to `always`, all tools will require approval. When 
set to `never`, all tools will not require approval.

schemas.name: MCPToolCall
schemas.description: An invocation of a tool on an MCP server.

type.description: The type of the item. Always `mcp_call`.

id.description: The unique ID of the tool call.

server_label.description: The label of the MCP server running the tool.

name.description: The name of the tool that was run.

arguments.description: A JSON string of the arguments passed to the tool.

output.description: The output from the tool call.

error.description: The error from the tool call, if any.

schemas.name: MCPToolFilter
schemas.description: A filter object to specify which tools are allowed.

read_only.description:
Indicates whether or not a tool modifies data or is read-only. If an
MCP server is [annotated with `readOnlyHint`](https://modelcontextprotocol.io/specification/2025-06-18/schema#toolannotations-readonlyhint),
it will match this filter.

schemas.name: MessageContentImageFileObject
schemas.description: References an image [File](https://platform.openai.com/docs/api-reference/files) in the content of a message.

type.description: Always `image_file`.

file_id.description: The [File](https://platform.openai.com/docs/api-reference/files) ID of the image in the message content. Set `purpose="vision"` when uploading the File if you need to later display the file content.

detail.description: Specifies the detail level of the image if specified by the user. `low` uses fewer tokens, you can opt in to high resolution using `high`.

schemas.name: MessageContentImageUrlObject
schemas.description: References an image URL in the content of a message.

type.description: The type of the content part.

url.description: The external URL of the image, must be a supported image types: jpeg, jpg, png, gif, webp.

detail.description: Specifies the detail level of the image. `low` uses fewer tokens, you can opt in to high resolution using `high`. Default value is `auto`

schemas.name: MessageContentRefusalObject
schemas.description: The refusal content generated by the assistant.

type.description: Always `refusal`.

schemas.name: MessageContentTextAnnotationsFileCitationObject
schemas.description: A citation within the message that points to a specific quote from a specific File associated with the assistant or the message. Generated when the assistant uses the "file_search" tool to search files.

type.description: Always `file_citation`.

text.description: The text in the message content that needs to be replaced.

file_id.description: The ID of the specific File the citation is from.

schemas.name: MessageContentTextAnnotationsFilePathObject
schemas.description: A URL for the file that's generated when the assistant used the `code_interpreter` tool to generate a file.

type.description: Always `file_path`.

text.description: The text in the message content that needs to be replaced.

file_id.description: The ID of the file that was generated.

schemas.name: MessageContentTextObject
schemas.description: The text content that is part of a message.

type.description: Always `text`.

value.description: The data that makes up the text.

schemas.name: MessageDeltaContentImageFileObject
schemas.description: References an image [File](https://platform.openai.com/docs/api-reference/files) in the content of a message.

index.description: The index of the content part in the message.

type.description: Always `image_file`.

file_id.description: The [File](https://platform.openai.com/docs/api-reference/files) ID of the image in the message content. Set `purpose="vision"` when uploading the File if you need to later display the file content.

detail.description: Specifies the detail level of the image if specified by the user. `low` uses fewer tokens, you can opt in to high resolution using `high`.

schemas.name: MessageDeltaContentImageUrlObject
schemas.description: References an image URL in the content of a message.

index.description: The index of the content part in the message.

type.description: Always `image_url`.

url.description: The URL of the image, must be a supported image types: jpeg, jpg, png, gif, webp.

detail.description: Specifies the detail level of the image. `low` uses fewer tokens, you can opt in to high resolution using `high`.

schemas.name: MessageDeltaContentRefusalObject
schemas.description: The refusal content that is part of a message.

index.description: The index of the refusal part in the message.

type.description: Always `refusal`.

schemas.name: MessageDeltaContentTextAnnotationsFileCitationObject
schemas.description: A citation within the message that points to a specific quote from a specific File associated with the assistant or the message. Generated when the assistant uses the "file_search" tool to search files.

index.description: The index of the annotation in the text content part.

type.description: Always `file_citation`.

text.description: The text in the message content that needs to be replaced.

file_id.description: The ID of the specific File the citation is from.

quote.description: The specific quote in the file.

schemas.name: MessageDeltaContentTextAnnotationsFilePathObject
schemas.description: A URL for the file that's generated when the assistant used the `code_interpreter` tool to generate a file.

index.description: The index of the annotation in the text content part.

type.description: Always `file_path`.

text.description: The text in the message content that needs to be replaced.

file_id.description: The ID of the file that was generated.

schemas.name: MessageDeltaContentTextObject
schemas.description: The text content that is part of a message.

index.description: The index of the content part in the message.

type.description: Always `text`.

value.description: The data that makes up the text.

schemas.name: MessageDeltaObject
schemas.description: Represents a message delta i.e. any changed fields on a message during streaming.

id.description: The identifier of the message, which can be referenced in API endpoints.

object.description: The object type, which is always `thread.message.delta`.

delta.description: The delta containing the fields that have changed on the Message.

role.description: The entity that produced the message. One of `user` or `assistant`.

content.description: The content of the message in array of text and/or images.

schemas.name: MessageObject
schemas.description: Represents a message within a [thread](https://platform.openai.com/docs/api-reference/threads).

id.description: The identifier, which can be referenced in API endpoints.

object.description: The object type, which is always `thread.message`.

created_at.description: The Unix timestamp (in seconds) for when the message was created.

thread_id.description: The [thread](https://platform.openai.com/docs/api-reference/threads) ID that this message belongs to.

status.description: The status of the message, which can be either `in_progress`, `incomplete`, or `completed`.

incomplete_details.description: On an incomplete message, details about why the message is incomplete.

reason.description: The reason the message is incomplete.

completed_at.description: The Unix timestamp (in seconds) for when the message was completed.

incomplete_at.description: The Unix timestamp (in seconds) for when the message was marked as incomplete.

role.description: The entity that produced the message. One of `user` or `assistant`.

content.description: The content of the message in array of text and/or images.

assistant_id.description: If applicable, the ID of the [assistant](https://platform.openai.com/docs/api-reference/assistants) that authored this message.

run_id.description: The ID of the [run](https://platform.openai.com/docs/api-reference/runs) associated with the creation of this message. Value is `null` when messages are created manually using the create message or create thread endpoints.

file_id.description: The ID of the file to attach to the message.

tools.description: The tools to add this file to.

attachments.description: A list of files attached to the message, and the tools they were added to.

schemas.name: MessageRequestContentTextObject
schemas.description: The text content that is part of a message.

type.description: Always `text`.

text.description: Text content to be sent to the model

schemas.name: Metadata
schemas.description:
Set of 16 key-value pairs that can be attached to an object. This can be
useful for storing additional information about the object in a structured
format, and querying for objects via API or the dashboard. 

Keys are strings with a maximum length of 64 characters. Values are strings
with a maximum length of 512 characters.

schemas.name: Model
schemas.description: Describes an OpenAI model offering that can be used with the API.

id.description: The model identifier, which can be referenced in the API endpoints.

created.description: The Unix timestamp (in seconds) when the model was created.

object.description: The object type, which is always "model".

owned_by.description: The organization that owns the model.

top_logprobs.description:
An integer between 0 and 20 specifying the number of most likely tokens to
return at each token position, each with an associated log probability.

temperature.description:
What sampling temperature to use, between 0 and 2. Higher values like 0.8 will make the output more random, while lower values like 0.2 will make it more focused and deterministic.
We generally recommend altering this or `top_p` but not both.

top_p.description:
An alternative to sampling with temperature, called nucleus sampling,
where the model considers the results of the tokens with top_p probability
mass. So 0.1 means only the tokens comprising the top 10% probability mass
are considered.

We generally recommend altering this or `temperature` but not both.

user.description:
This field is being replaced by `safety_identifier` and `prompt_cache_key`. Use `prompt_cache_key` instead to maintain caching optimizations.
A stable identifier for your end-users. 
Used to boost cache hit rates by better bucketing similar requests and  to help OpenAI detect and prevent abuse. [Learn more](https://platform.openai.com/docs/guides/safety-best-practices#safety-identifiers).

safety_identifier.description:
A stable identifier used to help detect users of your application that may be violating OpenAI's usage policies. 
The IDs should be a string that uniquely identifies each user. We recommend hashing their username or email address, in order to avoid sending us any identifying information. [Learn more](https://platform.openai.com/docs/guides/safety-best-practices#safety-identifiers).

prompt_cache_key.description: Used by OpenAI to cache responses for similar requests to optimize your cache hit rates. Replaces the `user` field. [Learn more](https://platform.openai.com/docs/guides/prompt-caching).

model.description: ID of the model to use. You can use the [List models](https://platform.openai.com/docs/api-reference/models/list) API to see all of your available models, or see our [Model overview](https://platform.openai.com/docs/models) for descriptions of them.

name.description: The name of the assistant. The maximum length is 256 characters.

description.description: The description of the assistant. The maximum length is 512 characters.

instructions.description: The system instructions that the assistant uses. The maximum length is 256,000 characters.

tools.description: A list of tool enabled on the assistant. There can be a maximum of 128 tools per assistant. Tools can be of types `code_interpreter`, `file_search`, or `function`.

tool_resources.description: A set of resources that are used by the assistant's tools. The resources are specific to the type of tool. For example, the `code_interpreter` tool requires a list of file IDs, while the `file_search` tool requires a list of vector store IDs.

file_ids.description: Overrides the list of [file](https://platform.openai.com/docs/api-reference/files) IDs made available to the `code_interpreter` tool. There can be a maximum of 20 files associated with the tool.

vector_store_ids.description: Overrides the [vector store](https://platform.openai.com/docs/api-reference/vector-stores/object) attached to this assistant. There can be a maximum of 1 vector store attached to the assistant.

temperature.description: What sampling temperature to use, between 0 and 2. Higher values like 0.8 will make the output more random, while lower values like 0.2 will make it more focused and deterministic.

top_p.description:
An alternative to sampling with temperature, called nucleus sampling, where the model considers the results of the tokens with top_p probability mass. So 0.1 means only the tokens comprising the top 10% probability mass are considered.

We generally recommend altering this or temperature but not both.

name.description: The updated name for the certificate

tool_resources.description: A set of resources that are made available to the assistant's tools in this thread. The resources are specific to the type of tool. For example, the `code_interpreter` tool requires a list of file IDs, while the `file_search` tool requires a list of vector store IDs.

file_ids.description: A list of [file](https://platform.openai.com/docs/api-reference/files) IDs made available to the `code_interpreter` tool. There can be a maximum of 20 files associated with the tool.

vector_store_ids.description: The [vector store](https://platform.openai.com/docs/api-reference/vector-stores/object) attached to this thread. There can be a maximum of 1 vector store attached to the thread.

schemas.name: Move
schemas.description: A mouse move action.

type.description:
Specifies the event type. For a move action, this property is 
always set to `move`.

schemas.name: OpenAIFile
schemas.description: The `File` object represents a document that has been uploaded to OpenAI.

id.description: The file identifier, which can be referenced in the API endpoints.

bytes.description: The size of the file, in bytes.

created_at.description: The Unix timestamp (in seconds) for when the file was created.

expires_at.description: The Unix timestamp (in seconds) for when the file will expire.

object.description: The object type, which is always `file`.

purpose.description: The intended purpose of the file. Supported values are `assistants`, `assistants_output`, `batch`, `batch_output`, `fine-tune`, `fine-tune-results`, `vision`, and `user_data`.

status.description: Deprecated. The current status of the file, which can be either `uploaded`, `processed`, or `error`.

status_details.description: Deprecated. For details on why a fine-tuning training file failed validation, see the `error` field on `fine_tuning.job`.

schemas.name: OtherChunkingStrategyResponseParam
schemas.description: This is returned when the chunking strategy is unknown. Typically, this is because the file was indexed before the `chunking_strategy` concept was introduced in the API.

type.description: Always `other`.

schemas.name: OutputAudio
schemas.description: An audio output from the model.

type.description: The type of the output audio. Always `output_audio`.

data.description: Base64-encoded audio data from the model.

transcript.description: The transcript of the audio data from the model.

schemas.name: OutputMessage
schemas.description: An output message from the model.

id.description: The unique ID of the output message.

type.description: The type of the output message. Always `message`.

role.description: The role of the output message. Always `assistant`.

content.description: The content of the output message.

status.description:
The status of the message input. One of `in_progress`, `completed`, or
`incomplete`. Populated when input items are returned via API.

schemas.name: ParallelToolCalls
schemas.description: Whether to enable [parallel function calling](https://platform.openai.com/docs/guides/function-calling#configuring-parallel-function-calling) during tool use.

schemas.name: PartialImages
schemas.description:
The number of partial images to generate. This parameter is used for
streaming responses that return partial images. Value must be between 0 and 3.
When set to 0, the response will be a single image sent in one streaming event.

Note that the final image may be sent before the full number of partial images 
are generated if the full image is generated more quickly.

schemas.name: PredictionContent
schemas.description:
Static predicted output content, such as the content of a text file that is
being regenerated.

type.description:
The type of the predicted content you want to provide. This type is
currently always `content`.

content.description:
The content that should be matched when generating a model response.
If generated tokens would match this content, the entire model response
can be returned much more quickly.

anyOf.title: Text content
anyOf.description:
The content used for a Predicted Output. This is often the
text of a file you are regenerating with minor changes.
An array of content parts with a defined type. Supported options differ based on the [model](https://platform.openai.com/docs/models) being used to generate the response. Can contain text inputs.
anyOf.title: Array of content parts
