schemas.name: RunStepObject
schemas.description: Represents a step in execution of a run.

id.description: The identifier of the run step, which can be referenced in API endpoints.

object.description: The object type, which is always `thread.run.step`.

created_at.description: The Unix timestamp (in seconds) for when the run step was created.

assistant_id.description: The ID of the [assistant](https://platform.openai.com/docs/api-reference/assistants) associated with the run step.

thread_id.description: The ID of the [thread](https://platform.openai.com/docs/api-reference/threads) that was run.

run_id.description: The ID of the [run](https://platform.openai.com/docs/api-reference/runs) that this run step is a part of.

type.description: The type of run step, which can be either `message_creation` or `tool_calls`.

status.description: The status of the run step, which can be either `in_progress`, `cancelled`, `failed`, `completed`, or `expired`.

step_details.description: The details of the run step.

last_error.description: The last error associated with this run step. Will be `null` if there are no errors.

message.description: A human-readable description of the error.

expired_at.description: The Unix timestamp (in seconds) for when the run step expired. A step is considered expired if the parent run is expired.

cancelled_at.description: The Unix timestamp (in seconds) for when the run step was cancelled.

failed_at.description: The Unix timestamp (in seconds) for when the run step failed.

completed_at.description: The Unix timestamp (in seconds) for when the run step completed.

schemas.name: RunToolCallObject
schemas.description: Tool call objects

id.description: The ID of the tool call. This ID must be referenced when you submit the tool outputs in using the [Submit tool outputs to run](https://platform.openai.com/docs/api-reference/runs/submitToolOutputs) endpoint.

type.description: The type of tool call the output is required for. For now, this is always `function`.

name.description: The name of the function.

arguments.description: The arguments that the model expects you to pass to the function.

schemas.name: Screenshot
schemas.description: A screenshot action.

type.description:
Specifies the event type. For a screenshot action, this property is 
always set to `screenshot`.

schemas.name: Scroll
schemas.description: A scroll action.

type.description:
Specifies the event type. For a scroll action, this property is 
always set to `scroll`.

x.description: The x-coordinate where the scroll occurred.

y.description: The y-coordinate where the scroll occurred.

schemas.name: ServiceTier
schemas.description:
Specifies the processing type used for serving the request.
  - If set to 'auto', then the request will be processed with the service tier configured in the Project settings. Unless otherwise configured, the Project will use 'default'.
  - If set to 'default', then the request will be processed with the standard pricing and performance for the selected model.
  - If set to '[flex](https://platform.openai.com/docs/guides/flex-processing)' or '[priority](https://openai.com/api-priority-processing/)', then the request will be processed with the corresponding service tier.
  - When not set, the default behavior is 'auto'.

  When the `service_tier` parameter is set, the response body will include the `service_tier` value based on the processing mode actually used to serve the request. This response value may be different from the value set in the parameter.

schemas.name: SpeechAudioDeltaEvent
schemas.description: Emitted for each chunk of audio data generated during speech synthesis.

type.description: The type of the event. Always `speech.audio.delta`.

audio.description: A chunk of Base64-encoded audio data.

schemas.name: SpeechAudioDoneEvent
schemas.description: Emitted when the speech synthesis is complete and all audio has been streamed.

type.description: The type of the event. Always `speech.audio.done`.

usage.description: Token usage statistics for the request.

input_tokens.description: Number of input tokens in the prompt.

total_tokens.description: Total number of tokens used (input + output).

max_chunk_size_tokens.description: The maximum number of tokens in each chunk. The default value is `800`. The minimum value is `100` and the maximum value is `4096`.

chunk_overlap_tokens.description:
The number of tokens that overlap between chunks. The default value is `400`.

Note that the overlap must not exceed half of `max_chunk_size_tokens`.

schemas.name: StaticChunkingStrategyRequestParam
schemas.description: Customize your own chunking strategy by setting chunk size and chunk overlap.

type.description: Always `static`.
Always `static`.

schemas.name: StopConfiguration
schemas.description:
Not supported with latest reasoning models `o3` and `o4-mini`.

Up to 4 sequences where the API will stop generating further tokens. The
returned text will not contain the stop sequence.

tool_outputs.description: A list of tools for which the outputs are being submitted.

tool_call_id.description: The ID of the tool call in the `required_action` object within the run object the output is being submitted for.

output.description: The output of the tool call to be submitted to continue the run.

stream.description: If `true`, returns a stream of events that happen during the Run as server-sent events, terminating when the Run enters a terminal state with a `data: [DONE]` message.

schemas.name: TextResponseFormatConfiguration
schemas.description:
An object specifying the format that the model must output.

Configuring `{ "type": "json_schema" }` enables Structured Outputs, 
which ensures the model will match your supplied JSON schema. Learn more in the 
[Structured Outputs guide](https://platform.openai.com/docs/guides/structured-outputs).

The default format is `{ "type": "text" }` with no additional options.

**Not recommended for gpt-4o and newer models:**

Setting to `{ "type": "json_object" }` enables the older JSON mode, which
ensures the message the model generates is valid JSON. Using `json_schema`
is preferred for models that support it.

schemas.name: TextResponseFormatJsonSchema
schemas.description:
JSON Schema response format. Used to generate structured JSON responses.
Learn more about [Structured Outputs](https://platform.openai.com/docs/guides/structured-outputs).

type.description: The type of response format being defined. Always `json_schema`.

description.description:
A description of what the response format is for, used by the model to
determine how to respond in the format.

name.description:
The name of the response format. Must be a-z, A-Z, 0-9, or contain
underscores and dashes, with a maximum length of 64.

strict.description:
Whether to enable strict schema adherence when generating the output.
If set to true, the model will always follow the exact schema defined
in the `schema` field. Only a subset of JSON Schema is supported when
`strict` is `true`. To learn more, read the [Structured Outputs
guide](https://platform.openai.com/docs/guides/structured-outputs).

schemas.name: ThreadObject
schemas.description: Represents a thread that contains [messages](https://platform.openai.com/docs/api-reference/messages).

id.description: The identifier, which can be referenced in API endpoints.

object.description: The object type, which is always `thread`.

created_at.description: The Unix timestamp (in seconds) for when the thread was created.

tool_resources.description: A set of resources that are made available to the assistant's tools in this thread. The resources are specific to the type of tool. For example, the `code_interpreter` tool requires a list of file IDs, while the `file_search` tool requires a list of vector store IDs.

file_ids.description: A list of [file](https://platform.openai.com/docs/api-reference/files) IDs made available to the `code_interpreter` tool. There can be a maximum of 20 files associated with the tool.

vector_store_ids.description: The [vector store](https://platform.openai.com/docs/api-reference/vector-stores/object) attached to this thread. There can be a maximum of 1 vector store attached to the thread.

schemas.name: Tool
schemas.description: A tool that can be used to generate a response.

schemas.name: ToolChoiceAllowed
schemas.description: Constrains the tools available to the model to a pre-defined set.

type.description: Allowed tool configuration type. Always `allowed_tools`.

mode.description:
Constrains the tools available to the model to a pre-defined set.

`auto` allows the model to pick from among the allowed tools and generate a
message.

`required` requires the model to call one or more of the allowed tools.

tools.description:
A list of tool definitions that the model should be allowed to call.

For the Responses API, the list of tool definitions might look like:
```json
[
  { "type": "function", "name": "get_weather" },
  { "type": "mcp", "server_label": "deepwiki" },
  { "type": "image_generation" }
]
```

items.description: A tool definition that the model should be allowed to call.

schemas.name: ToolChoiceCustom
schemas.description: Use this option to force the model to call a specific custom tool.

type.description: For custom tool calling, the type is always `custom`.

name.description: The name of the custom tool to call.

schemas.name: ToolChoiceFunction
schemas.description: Use this option to force the model to call a specific function.

type.description: For function calling, the type is always `function`.

name.description: The name of the function to call.

schemas.name: ToolChoiceMCP
schemas.description: Use this option to force the model to call a specific tool on a remote MCP server.

type.description: For MCP tools, the type is always `mcp`.

server_label.description: The label of the MCP server to use.

name.description: The name of the tool to call on the server.

schemas.name: ToolChoiceOptions
schemas.description:
Controls which (if any) tool is called by the model.

`none` means the model will not call any tool and instead generates a message.

`auto` means the model can pick between generating a message or calling one or
more tools.

`required` means the model must call one or more tools.

schemas.name: ToolChoiceTypes
schemas.description:
Indicates that the model should use a built-in tool to generate a response.
[Learn more about built-in tools](https://platform.openai.com/docs/guides/tools).

type.description:
The type of hosted tool the model should to use. Learn more about
[built-in tools](https://platform.openai.com/docs/guides/tools).

Allowed values are:
- `file_search`
- `web_search_preview`
- `computer_use_preview`
- `code_interpreter`
- `image_generation`

schemas.name: TranscriptTextDeltaEvent
schemas.description: Emitted when there is an additional text delta. This is also the first event emitted when the transcription starts. Only emitted when you [create a transcription](https://platform.openai.com/docs/api-reference/audio/create-transcription) with the `Stream` parameter set to `true`.

type.description: The type of the event. Always `transcript.text.delta`.

delta.description: The text delta that was additionally transcribed.

logprobs.description: The log probabilities of the delta. Only included if you [create a transcription](https://platform.openai.com/docs/api-reference/audio/create-transcription) with the `include[]` parameter set to `logprobs`.

token.description: The token that was used to generate the log probability.

logprob.description: The log probability of the token.

bytes.description: The bytes that were used to generate the log probability.

schemas.name: TranscriptTextDoneEvent
schemas.description: Emitted when the transcription is complete. Contains the complete transcription text. Only emitted when you [create a transcription](https://platform.openai.com/docs/api-reference/audio/create-transcription) with the `Stream` parameter set to `true`.

type.description: The type of the event. Always `transcript.text.done`.

text.description: The text that was transcribed.

logprobs.description: The log probabilities of the individual tokens in the transcription. Only included if you [create a transcription](https://platform.openai.com/docs/api-reference/audio/create-transcription) with the `include[]` parameter set to `logprobs`.

token.description: The token that was used to generate the log probability.

logprob.description: The log probability of the token.

bytes.description: The bytes that were used to generate the log probability.

schemas.name: TranscriptTextUsageDuration
schemas.description: Usage statistics for models billed by audio input duration.

type.description: The type of the usage object. Always `duration` for this variant.

seconds.description: Duration of the input audio in seconds.

schemas.name: TranscriptTextUsageTokens
schemas.description: Usage statistics for models billed by token usage.

type.description: The type of the usage object. Always `tokens` for this variant.

input_tokens.description: Number of input tokens billed for this request.

input_token_details.description: Details about the input tokens billed for this request.

text_tokens.description: Number of text tokens billed for this request.

audio_tokens.description: Number of audio tokens billed for this request.

total_tokens.description: Total number of tokens used (input + output).

schemas.name: TranscriptionChunkingStrategy
schemas.description: Controls how the audio is cut into chunks. When set to `"auto"`, the server first normalizes loudness and then uses voice activity detection (VAD) to choose boundaries. `server_vad` object can be provided to tweak VAD detection parameters manually. If unset, the audio is transcribed as a single block.

id.description: Unique identifier of the segment.

start.description: Start time of the segment in seconds.

end.description: End time of the segment in seconds.

text.description: Text content of the segment.

tokens.description: Array of token IDs for the text content.

temperature.description: Temperature parameter used for generating the segment.

avg_logprob.description: Average logprob of the segment. If the value is lower than -1, consider the logprobs failed.

compression_ratio.description: Compression ratio of the segment. If the value is greater than 2.4, consider the compression failed.

no_speech_prob.description: Probability of no speech in the segment. If the value is higher than 1.0 and the `avg_logprob` is below -1, consider this segment silent.

word.description: The text content of the word.

start.description: Start time of the word in seconds.

end.description: End time of the word in seconds.

schemas.name: TruncationObject
schemas.description: Controls for how a thread will be truncated prior to the run. Use this to control the initial context window of the run.

type.description: The truncation strategy to use for the thread. The default is `auto`. If set to `last_messages`, the thread will be truncated to the n most recent messages in the thread. When set to `auto`, messages in the middle of the thread will be dropped to fit the context length of the model, `max_prompt_tokens`.

last_messages.description: The number of most recent messages from the thread when constructing the context for the run.

schemas.name: Type
schemas.description: An action to type in text.

type.description:
Specifies the event type. For a type action, this property is 
always set to `type`.

text.description: The text to type.

name.description: The name of the vector store.

schemas.name: Upload
schemas.description: The Upload object can accept byte chunks in the form of Parts.

id.description: The Upload unique identifier, which can be referenced in API endpoints.

created_at.description: The Unix timestamp (in seconds) for when the Upload was created.

filename.description: The name of the file to be uploaded.

bytes.description: The intended number of bytes to be uploaded.

purpose.description: The intended purpose of the file. [Please refer here](https://platform.openai.com/docs/api-reference/files/object#files/object-purpose) for acceptable values.

status.description: The status of the Upload.

expires_at.description: The Unix timestamp (in seconds) for when the Upload will expire.

object.description: The object type, which is always "upload".

allOf.description: The ready File object after the Upload is completed.

name.description: An optional name for the certificate

content.description: The certificate content in PEM format

schemas.name: UploadPart
schemas.description: The upload Part represents a chunk of bytes we can add to an Upload object.

created_at.description: The Unix timestamp (in seconds) for when the Part was created.

upload_id.description: The ID of the Upload object that this Part was added to.

object.description: The object type, which is always `upload.part`.

schemas.name: User
schemas.description: Represents an individual `user` within an organization.

object.description: The object type, which is always `organization.user`

id.description: The identifier, which can be referenced in API endpoints

name.description: The name of the user

email.description: The email address of the user

role.description: `owner` or `reader`

added_at.description: The Unix timestamp (in seconds) of when the user was added.

role.description: `owner` or `reader`

type.description: Must be set to `server_vad` to enable manual chunking using server side VAD.

prefix_padding_ms.description:
Amount of audio to include before the VAD detected speech (in 
milliseconds).

silence_duration_ms.description:
Duration of silence to detect speech stop (in milliseconds).
With shorter values the model will respond more quickly, 
but may jump in on short pauses from the user.

threshold.description:
Sensitivity threshold (0.0 to 1.0) for voice activity detection. A 
higher threshold will require louder audio to activate the model, and 
thus might perform better in noisy environments.

grader.description: The grader used for the fine-tuning job.
The grader used for the fine-tuning job.

schemas.name: VectorStoreExpirationAfter
schemas.description: The expiration policy for a vector store.

anchor.description: Anchor timestamp after which the expiration policy applies. Supported anchors: `last_active_at`.

days.description: The number of days after the anchor time that the vector store will expire.

schemas.name: VectorStoreFileAttributes
schemas.description:
Set of 16 key-value pairs that can be attached to an object. This can be 
useful for storing additional information about the object in a structured 
format, and querying for objects via API or the dashboard. Keys are strings 
with a maximum length of 64 characters. Values are strings with a maximum 
length of 512 characters, booleans, or numbers.

schemas.name: VectorStoreFileBatchObject
schemas.description: A batch of files attached to a vector store.

id.description: The identifier, which can be referenced in API endpoints.

instructions.description: Override the default system message of the assistant. This is useful for modifying the behavior on a per-run basis.

tools.description: Override the tools the assistant can use for this run. This is useful for modifying the behavior on a per-run basis.

tool_resources.description: A set of resources that are used by the assistant's tools. The resources are specific to the type of tool. For example, the `code_interpreter` tool requires a list of file IDs, while the `file_search` tool requires a list of vector store IDs.

temperature.description: What sampling temperature to use, between 0 and 2. Higher values like 0.8 will make the output more random, while lower values like 0.2 will make it more focused and deterministic.

top_p.description:
An alternative to sampling with temperature, called nucleus sampling, where the model considers the results of the tokens with top_p probability mass. So 0.1 means only the tokens comprising the top 10% probability mass are considered.

We generally recommend altering this or temperature but not both.

max_prompt_tokens.description: The maximum number of prompt tokens that may be used over the course of the run. The run will make a best effort to use only the number of prompt tokens specified, across multiple turns of the run. If the run exceeds the number of prompt tokens specified, the run will end with status `incomplete`. See `incomplete_details` for more info.

max_completion_tokens.description: The maximum number of completion tokens that may be used over the course of the run. The run will make a best effort to use only the number of completion tokens specified, across multiple turns of the run. If the run exceeds the number of completion tokens specified, the run will end with status `incomplete`. See `incomplete_details` for more info.

assistant_id.description: The ID of the [assistant](https://platform.openai.com/docs/api-reference/assistants) to use to execute this run.

model.description: The ID of the [Model](https://platform.openai.com/docs/api-reference/models) to be used to execute this run. If a value is provided here, it will override the model associated with the assistant. If not, the model associated with the assistant will be used.

instructions.description: Overrides the [instructions](https://platform.openai.com/docs/api-reference/assistants/createAssistant) of the assistant. This is useful for modifying the behavior on a per-run basis.

additional_instructions.description: Appends additional instructions at the end of the instructions for the run. This is useful for modifying the behavior on a per-run basis without overriding other instructions.

additional_messages.description: Adds additional messages to the thread before creating the run.

tools.description: Override the tools the assistant can use for this run. This is useful for modifying the behavior on a per-run basis.

temperature.description: What sampling temperature to use, between 0 and 2. Higher values like 0.8 will make the output more random, while lower values like 0.2 will make it more focused and deterministic.

top_p.description:
An alternative to sampling with temperature, called nucleus sampling, where the model considers the results of the tokens with top_p probability mass. So 0.1 means only the tokens comprising the top 10% probability mass are considered.

We generally recommend altering this or temperature but not both.

max_prompt_tokens.description: The maximum number of prompt tokens that may be used over the course of the run. The run will make a best effort to use only the number of prompt tokens specified, across multiple turns of the run. If the run exceeds the number of prompt tokens specified, the run will end with status `incomplete`. See `incomplete_details` for more info.

max_completion_tokens.description: The maximum number of completion tokens that may be used over the course of the run. The run will make a best effort to use only the number of completion tokens specified, across multiple turns of the run. If the run exceeds the number of completion tokens specified, the run will end with status `incomplete`. See `incomplete_details` for more info.

tool_outputs.description: A list of tools for which the outputs are being submitted.

tool_call_id.description: The ID of the tool call in the `required_action` object within the run object the output is being submitted for.

output.description: The output of the tool call to be submitted to continue the run.

schemas.name: RunStatus
schemas.description: The status of the run, which can be either `queued`, `in_progress`, `requires_action`, `cancelling`, `cancelled`, `failed`, `completed`, `incomplete`, or `expired`.

schemas.name: RunStepDeltaObjectDelta
schemas.description: The delta containing the fields that have changed on the run step.

step_details.description: The details of the run step.
